repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
I hope my C isn't awful :sweat_smile: 

My only concern is that the error message for me doesn't show the caret (^) indicator of where exactly an error might be (maybe because it's on a newline below it?)

~I was also unsure about convention for allocations failing (hence the comments...)~ Linter warned me about using xstr(n)dup

comment_regular_data.body: Can you show a screenshot of (or copy&paste) the new error message?

Is it hard to write tests for this? There are many cases. And tests would make it obvious what the messages will look like (I'm curious about why newline is used in some cases but not others). `helpers.pcall_err()` will be useful.

See [test/functional/example_spec.lua](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/test/functional/example_spec.lua) for example. You can [run the test](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/test/README.md#running-tests) like this:

    TEST_FILE=test/functional/example_spec.lua make functionaltest

We should also add these errors to `messages` somehow. The current virtual text is virtually unreadable.

A simpler alternative is to replace the end-of-line virtual text by a virtual line, either above -- if possible -- or below the first (visible?) line.

We should also consider upstreaming the query healthcheck from nvim-treesitter.

The virtual_text errors are just a consequence of the queries running inside decoration provider callbacks.

We need to revive #19814 so errors are just printed normally, but in a way to not completly clobber nvim since the errors are triggered on every line.
To be clear, those aren't blockers for this PR , right?

No, but a _useful_ way of exposing these errors is sorely needed. Upstreaming the checkhealth is probably the simplest (just a simple `pcall` of `vim.treesitter.query.get` of all queries in runtimepath and either print "all queries OK" or just surface the error suffices).

But this change is of course a big improvement already and will be helpful for `nvim-treesitter` (as soon as that is updated to account to the new multiline error message).

Here's how the new error looks, by the way:
```
E5108: Error executing lua /usr/local/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/query.lua:273: Query error at 3:2. Invalid node type dentifier)
```

So suggestions: 

1. add quotes around the node type to make it clear what the verbatim node is;
2. there seems to be an off-by-one error, since the opening paren is missing but the closing paren is shown (the full -- deliberately wrong -- node is `(dentifier)`).

> there seems to be an off-by-one error, since the opening paren is missing but the closing paren is shown.

is the `dentifier` perhaps also another off-by-one error? or just copy paste error?

> Here's how the new error looks, by the way:
> 
> ```
> E5108: Error executing lua /usr/local/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/query.lua:273: Query error at 3:2. Invalid node type dentifier)
> ```
> 
> So suggestions:
> 
> 1. add quotes around the node type to make it clear what the verbatim node is;
> 2. there seems to be an off-by-one error, since the opening paren is missing but the closing paren is shown (the full -- deliberately wrong -- node is `(dentifier)`).

Think that was from 20 extra bytes not being enough to hold the msg, 40 should be fine

I'll see if I can add tests but I might need some help there..

Here's what it looks like for me now (node quoted w/ extra room)
![image](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/29718261/e5226673-54b4-4b5f-aa13-0a39f138de1c)

> (I'm curious about why newline is used in some cases but not others).

Those are for specific recognizable nodes/fields/captures that are impossible, of which they are displayed right after then. The others don't have that

title: feat(treesitter): improve query error message
